pyaemia.gloss: septicemia caused by pus-forming bacteria being released from an abscess

pycnanthemum virginianum.gloss: perennial herb of the eastern United States having inconspicuous greenish flowers and narrow leaves that are very aromatic when bruised

pycnogonid.gloss: any of various small spiderlike marine arthropods having small thin bodies and long slender legs

pycnosis.gloss: a degenerative state of the cell nucleus

pydna.gloss: a major victory by the Romans over the Macedonians in 168 BC

pye-dog.gloss: ownerless half-wild mongrel dog common around Asian villages especially India

pyemia.gloss: septicemia caused by pus-forming bacteria being released from an abscess

pygmy chimpanzee.gloss: small chimpanzee of swamp forests in Zaire

pygmy cypress.gloss: rare small cypress native to northern California

pygmy mouse.gloss: very small dark greyish brown mouse resembling a house mouse

pygmy sperm whale.gloss: small sperm whale of warm waters of both coasts of North America

pygoscelis adeliae.gloss: medium-sized penguins occurring in large colonies on the Adelie Coast of Antarctica

pyjama.gloss: a pair of loose trousers tied by a drawstring around the waist
(usually plural) loose-fitting nightclothes worn for sleeping or lounging

pyknosis.gloss: a degenerative state of the cell nucleus

pyle.gloss: United States writer and illustrator of children's books (1853-1911)

pylodictus olivaris.gloss: large catfish of central United States having a flattened head and projecting jaw

pylon.gloss: a large vertical steel tower supporting high-tension power lines

pyloric sphincter.gloss: the sphincter muscle of the pylorus that separates the stomach from the duodenum

pyloric valve.gloss: the sphincter muscle of the pylorus that separates the stomach from the duodenum

pyloric vein.gloss: receives veins from the upper surfaces of the stomach and empties into the portal vein

pynchon.gloss: United States writer of pessimistic novels about life in a technologically advanced society (born in 1937)

pyongyang.gloss: capital of North Korea and an industrial center

pyotr ilych tchaikovsky.gloss: important Russian composer whose works are noted for their expressive melodies (1840-1893)

pyotr tchaikovsky.gloss: important Russian composer whose works are noted for their expressive melodies (1840-1893)

pyracanth.gloss: any of various thorny shrubs of the genus Pyracantha bearing small white flowers followed by hard red or orange-red berries

pyracantha.gloss: any of various thorny shrubs of the genus Pyracantha bearing small white flowers followed by hard red or orange-red berries

pyralid.gloss: usually tropical slender-bodied long-legged moth whose larvae are crop pests

pyralid moth.gloss: usually tropical slender-bodied long-legged moth whose larvae are crop pests

pyramid.gloss: a massive monument with a square base and four triangular sides

pyramid plant.gloss: any of various tall perennial herbs constituting the genus Frasera

pyramidal bone.gloss: a wrist bone that articulates with the pisiform and hamate and lunate bones

pyramidal motor system.gloss: any of the important motor nerves on each side of the central nervous system that run from the sensorimotor areas of the cortex through the brainstem to motor neurons of the cranial nerve nuclei and the ventral root of the spinal cord

pyramidal tract.gloss: any of the important motor nerves on each side of the central nervous system that run from the sensorimotor areas of the cortex through the brainstem to motor neurons of the cranial nerve nuclei and the ventral root of the spinal cord

pyramids of egypt.gloss: a massive monument with a square base and four triangular sides

pyrausta.gloss: moths whose larvae are corn borers

pyrausta nubilalis.gloss: larva of the European corn borer moth

pyre.gloss: wood heaped for burning a dead body as a funeral rite

pyrectic.gloss: any substance that can cause a rise in body temperature

pyrenees daisy.gloss: perennial of Portugal similar to the oxeye daisy

pyrenomycetes.gloss: class of fungi in which the fruiting body is a perithecium

pyrethrum.gloss: white-flowered pyrethrum of Balkan area whose pinnate leaves are white and silky-hairy below
spring-flowering garden perennial of Asiatic origin having finely divided aromatic leaves and white to pink-purple flowers
used in former classifications for plants later placed in genus Chrysanthemum and now often included in genus Tanacetum

pyrexia.gloss: a rise in the temperature of the body

pyridium.gloss: analgesic (trade name Pyridium) used to treat urinary tract infections

pyridoxal.gloss: a B vitamin that is essential for metabolism of amino acids and starch

pyridoxamine.gloss: a B vitamin that is essential for metabolism of amino acids and starch

pyridoxine.gloss: a B vitamin that is essential for metabolism of amino acids and starch

pyriform area.gloss: pear-shaped neural structure on either side of the brain in the rhinencephalon

pyriform lobe.gloss: pear-shaped neural structure on either side of the brain in the rhinencephalon

pyrite.gloss: a common mineral (iron disulfide) that has a pale yellow color

pyrocephalus rubinus mexicanus.gloss: tropical American flycatcher found as far north as southern Texas and Arizona

pyrochemical process.gloss: processes for chemical reactions at high temperatures

pyrochemistry.gloss: processes for chemical reactions at high temperatures

pyrogallic acid.gloss: a toxic white lustrous crystalline phenol used to treat certain skin diseases and as a photographic developer

pyrogallol.gloss: a toxic white lustrous crystalline phenol used to treat certain skin diseases and as a photographic developer

pyrogen.gloss: any substance that can cause a rise in body temperature

pyrola.gloss: any of several evergreen perennials of the genus Pyrola

pyrola americana.gloss: evergreen of eastern North America with leathery leaves and numerous white flowers

pyrola elliptica.gloss: North American evergreen with small pinkish bell-shaped flowers and oblong leaves used formerly for shinplasters

pyrola minor.gloss: the common wintergreen having many-flowered racemes of pink-tinged white flowers

pyrola rotundifolia.gloss: evergreen with rounded leaves and very fragrant creamy-white flowers

pyrola rotundifolia americana.gloss: evergreen of eastern North America with leathery leaves and numerous white flowers

pyrola uniflora.gloss: delicate evergreen dwarf herb of north temperate regions having a solitary white terminal flower

pyrolaceae.gloss: evergreen herbs of temperate regions: genera Pyrola, Chimaphila, Moneses, Orthilia

pyroligneous acid.gloss: a red-brown liquid formed in distillation of wood which contains acetic acid, methanol, acetone, wood oils, and tars

pyromorphite.gloss: a mineral consisting of lead chloride and phosphate

pyrophorus noctiluca.gloss: tropical American click beetle having bright luminous spots

pyroscope.gloss: a pyrometer that uses the color of the light emitted by a hot object

pyrosis.gloss: a painful burning sensation in the chest caused by gastroesophageal reflux (backflow from the stomach irritating the esophagus)

pyrotechnic.gloss: of or relating to the craft of making fireworks

pyroxylin.gloss: highly flammable nitrocellulose used in making collodion and plastics and lacquers

pyroxyline.gloss: highly flammable nitrocellulose used in making collodion and plastics and lacquers

pyrrhic.gloss: a metrical unit with unstressed-unstressed syllables

pyrrhotine.gloss: a brownish iron sulfide mineral (FeS) having weak magnetic properties

pyrrhotite.gloss: a brownish iron sulfide mineral (FeS) having weak magnetic properties

pyrrhula pyrrhula.gloss: common European finch mostly black and white with red throat and breast

pyrrhuloxia.gloss: crested grey-and-red bird of southwest United States and Mexico

pyrrhuloxia sinuata.gloss: crested grey-and-red bird of southwest United States and Mexico

pyrrophyta.gloss: a division of lower plants comprising unicellular and biflagellate algae that form starchy compounds

pyrrosia.gloss: epiphytic or lithophytic or terrestrial ferns of tropical Old World

pyrrosia lingua.gloss: east Asian fern having fronds shaped like tongues

pyrularia.gloss: small genus of chiefly Asiatic parasitic shrubs

pyrularia pubera.gloss: shrub of southeastern United States parasitic on roots of hemlocks having sparse spikes of greenish flowers and pulpy drupes

pyrus.gloss: fruit trees native to the Old World: pears

pyrus communis.gloss: Old World tree having sweet gritty-textured juicy fruit

pythia.gloss: (Greek mythology) the priestess of Apollo at Delphi who transmitted the oracles

pythiaceae.gloss: fungi having sporangia usually borne successively and singly at the tips of branching sporangiophores

pythium debaryanum.gloss: fungus causing damping off disease in seedlings

python molurus.gloss: very large python of southeast Asia

python reticulatus.gloss: of southeast Asia and East Indies

python sebae.gloss: very large python of tropical and southern Africa

python variegatus.gloss: Australian python with a variegated pattern on its back

pythoness.gloss: (Greek mythology) the priestess of Apollo at Delphi who transmitted the oracles

pythonidae.gloss: in some classifications a family separate from Boidae comprising Old World boas

pyx.gloss: a chest in which coins from the mint are held to await assay

pyx chest.gloss: a chest in which coins from the mint are held to await assay

pyxidanthera barbulata.gloss: creeping evergreen shrub having narrow overlapping leaves and early white star-shaped flowers

pyxidium.gloss: fruit of such plants as the plantain

pyxie.gloss: creeping evergreen shrub having narrow overlapping leaves and early white star-shaped flowers

pyxis.gloss: fruit of such plants as the plantain

pycnotic.gloss: of or relating to or exhibiting pyknosis

pyknic.gloss: having a squat and fleshy build

pyknotic.gloss: of or relating to or exhibiting pyknosis

pyrogenic.gloss: produced under conditions involving intense heat

pyrogenous.gloss: produced under conditions involving intense heat
